intro: Cheilanthes rawsonii, commonly known as the Rawson's rockcap, is a species of fern that belongs to the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and is typically found in rocky or crevice habitats. The plant has thick, leathery fronds that are often covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on limestone or sandstone substrates. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is considered an important indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
